info.title: Payments
info.description: Call the Payments API to authorize payments, capture authorized payments, refund payments that have already been captured, and show payment information. Use the Payments API in conjunction with the Orders API. For more information, see the PayPal Checkout Overview.

scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/services/payments: Permission to do non-real time payments like capture on authorization
Permission to initiate a refund on a capture transaction

post.description:
Authorizes partial or full amount of a saved order payment, by order ID. Authorize partial or full amount of a saved order to ensure that funds are available for capturing the amount.

You can authorize amount for up to 115% of the saved order amount.

Note: This request is currently not supported and available for external API callers..

parameters.name: PayPal-Request-Id
parameters.description: The server stores keys for 45 days.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description:
The preferred server response upon successful completion of the request. Value is:
  • return=minimal. The server returns a minimal response to optimize communication between the API caller and the server. A minimal response includes the id, status and HATEOAS links.
  • return=representation. The server returns a complete resource representation, including the current state of the resource.

post.description:
Reauthorizes an authorized PayPal account payment, by ID. To ensure that funds are still available, reauthorize a payment after its initial three-day honor period expires. You can reauthorize a payment only once from days four to 29.

If 30 days have transpired since the date of the original authorization, you must create an authorized payment instead of reauthorizing the original authorized payment.

A reauthorized payment itself has a new honor period of three days.

You can reauthorize an authorized payment once for up to 115% of the original authorized amount, not to exceed an increase of $75 USD.

Supports only the `amount` request parameter.
Note: This request is currently not supported for Partner use cases.

authorization_request.json.title: Authorization Request
authorization_request.json.description: Authorizes either a portion or the full amount of a saved order.

order_id.description: The identifier of the order for this authorization.

payment_source.description: The identifier of the payment source we want to pre-authorize.

amount.description: The amount to authorize. The authorization amount can be a portion of the full order amount or the full order amount. The amount must be a positive number and in the same currency as the order amount against which the payment is being authorized.

intent.description: The intent of the authorization payment api call

x-enum.description: Authorize the amount of funds on selected payment option.
Check the availability the amount of funds on selected payment option.

payee.description: The merchant who receives payment for this transaction.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice ID for this order.

items.description: An array of items that the customer purchases from the merchant.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Card
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The payment card to use to fund a payment. Can be a credit or debit card.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the card.

name.description: The card holder's name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The primary account number (PAN) for the payment card.

expiry.description: The card expiration year and month, in [Internet date format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

security_code.description: The three- or four-digit security code of the card. Also known as the CVV, CVC, CVN, CVE, or CID.

last_digits.description: The last digits of the payment card.

card_type.description: The card brand or network. Typically used in the response.

billing_address.description: The billing address for this card. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

attributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this card.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The year and month, in ISO-8601 `YYYY-MM` date format. See [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Card Brand
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The card network or brand. Applies to credit, debit, gift, and payment cards.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement for Brazil, direction text, such as `next to Walmart`, or a landmark in an Indian address.

admin_area_4.description:
The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_3` or `sub_locality`. Value is:
  • The postal sorting code for Guernsey and many French territories, such as French Guiana.
  • The fine-grained administrative levels in China.

admin_area_3.description:
A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_2`. Value is:
  • Brazil. Suburb, bairro, or neighborhood.
  • India. Sub-locality or district. Street name information is not always available but a sub-locality or district can be a very small area.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

address_details.title: Address Details
address_details.description:
The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed. Not portable with common third party and open source. Redundant with core fields.
For example, `address_portable.address_line_1` is usually a combination of `address_details.street_number`, `street_name`, and `street_type`.

street_name.description: The street name. Just `Drury` in `Drury Lane`.

street_type.description: The street type. For example, avenue, boulevard, road, or expressway.

delivery_service.description: The delivery service. Post office box, bag number, or post office name.

building_name.description: A named locations that represents the premise. Usually a building name or number or collection of buildings with a common name or number. For example, Craven House.

sub_building.description: The first-order entity below a named building or location that represents the sub-premise. Usually a single building within a collection of buildings with a common name. Can be a flat, story, floor, room, or apartment.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: The 3D Secure Authentication Result
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Additional 3D Secure authentication data.

eci_flag.description: Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI). The ECI value is part of the 2 data elements that indicate the transaction was processed electronically. This should be passed on the authorization transaction to the Gateway/Processor.

ucaf_indicator.description: Universal Cardholder Authentication Field (UCAF) Indicator value provided by the issuer.

card_brand.description: Card brand that the transaction was processed for authentication.

cavv.description: This is the cardholder authentication value. The CAVV is unique to the cardholder and to the transaction that was authenticated.

xid.description: Transaction identifier resulting from authentication processing.

pares_status.description: Transactions status result identifier. The outcome of the issuer's authentication.

merchant_name.description: The merchant name that was sent in the authentication request.

three_ds_version.description: The 3DS version that was used to process the transaction.

directory_server_transaction_id.description: Unique transaction identifier assigned by the Directory Server (DS) to identify a single transaction.

authentication_type.description: Indicates the type of authentication that will be used to challenge the card holder.

access_control_server_transaction_id.description: Unique transaction identifier assigned by the Access Control Server (ACS) to identify a single transaction.

paypal_acquiring_mid.description: The PayPal acquiring MID to be used for authorization.

paypal_acquiring_bin.description: The PayPal acquiring BIN to be used for authorization.

cavv_algorithm.description: Indicates the algorithm used to generate the CAVV value.

three_ds_server_transaction_id.description: Unique transaction identifier assigned by the 3DS Server to identify a single transaction.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Authentication Result Type
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Indicates the form of authentication used on the financial instrument.

type.description: The type of authentication used on the financial instrument.

x-enum.description: The card was authenticated using 3D Secure (3DS) authentication scheme.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI). The ECI value is part of the 2 data elements that indicate the transaction was processed electronically. This should be passed on the authorization transaction to the Gateway/Processor.

x-enum.description: VISA, AMEX, JCB, DINERS CLUB fully authenticated transaction.
VISA, AMEX, JCB, DINERS CLUB attempted authentication transaction.
VISA, AMEX, JCB, DINERS CLUB non-3-D Secure transaction.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Universal Cardholder Authentication Field (UCAF) Indicator value provided by the issuer.

x-enum.description: Non-SecureCode transaction, bypassed by the merchant.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Card brand that the transaction was processed for authentication.
Status of Authentication eligibility.

x-enum.description: Yes. The bank is participating in 3-D Secure protocol and will return the ACSUrl.
No. The bank is not participating in 3-D Secure protocol.
Unavailable. The DS or ACS is not available for authentication at the time of the request.
Bypass. The merchant authentication rule is triggered to bypass authentication.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Transactions status result identifier. The outcome of the issuer's authentication.

x-enum.description: Failed authentication / account not verified / transaction denied.
Authentication rejected (merchant must not submit for authorization).
Informational only; 3DS requestor challenge preference acknowledged.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Indicates the type of authentication that was used to challenge the card holder.

x-enum.description: Indicates one-time password. Could be single-step or multi-step.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Transaction signature status identifier.

x-enum.description: Indicates that the signature of the PARes has been validated successfully and the message contents can be trusted.
Indicates that the PARes could not be validated.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Indicates the algorithm used to generate the CAVV/AAV value.

x-enum.description: Refers to the Visa CAVV generation specification that includes a unique identifier built into the value.
Refers to Secure Payment Algorithm used to generate Mastercard's Accountholder Authentication Value (AAV).

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Card Attributes
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this card

vault.description: Instruction to vault the card based on the specified strategy.

verification.description: Instruction to optionally verify the card based on the specified strategy

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Customer information on merchant's or partner's system of records
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details about a customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.
The unique ID for a customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Base vault Instruction parameters
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Basic vault instruction specification that can be extended by specific payment sources that supports vaulting.

confirm_payment_token.description: Defines how and when the payment source gets vaulted.

x-enum.description: Defines that the payer's payment-source should be vaulted only when at least one payment (authorization/capture) using that payment-source is successful.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The API caller can opt in to verify the card through PayPal offered verification services (e.g. Smart Dollar Auth, 3DS).

x-enum.description: The contingency surfaced as an additional security layer that helps prevent unauthorized card-not-present transactions and protects the merchant from exposure to fraud.

Places a temporary hold on the card to ensure its validity. This process protects the merchant from exposure to fraud. This verification method will confirm that the address information or CVV included matches what the issuing bank has on file for the associated card, ensuring that only authorized card users are able to make purchases from you.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Token
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The tokenized payment source to fund a payment.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the token.

type.description: The tokenization method that generated the ID.

x-enum.description: A secure, one-time-use reference to a payment source, such as payment card or PayPal account.
The payment method token, which is a reference to a transactional payment source. Typically stored on the merchant's server.
The PayPal billing agreement ID. References an approved recurring payment for goods or services.
The PayPal funding option ID. Represents a payment plan identifier computed based on buyer wallet, seller account and transaction currency.

This input is primarily aimed at providing backward compatibility to approved merchants that have previously integrated with [DoReferenceTransaction](https://developer.paypal.com/docs/classic/api/merchant/DoReferenceTransaction-API-Operation-NVP/?mark=DoReferenceTransaction). The use is analogous to the use of [ReferenceID](https://developer.paypal.com/docs/classic/api/merchant/DoReferenceTransaction-API-Operation-NVP/?mark=REFERENCEID) field within the DoReferenceTransaction API. The value is typically a valid transaction ID from a previous purchase, such as a card charge using the DoDirectPayment API. Transaction IDs are valid for 4 years from the transaction date.

This input is primarily aimed at providing backward compatibility to approved merchants that have previously integrated with [PayFlow SubmitReferenceTransactions](https://developer.paypal.com/docs/classic/payflow/integration-guide/submit-transactions/?mark=Reference%20Transactions#submit-reference-transactions---tokenization). The [PNREF](https://developer.paypal.com/docs/classic/payflow/integration-guide/transaction-responses/?mark=pnref#pnref) is a unique transaction identification number issued by PayPal. The `PNREF` is returned in a transaction response indicating that your transaction was received by PayPal. `PNREF` is valid for 15 months from the transaction date.

This id is the authorization id from previously successful authorization call.  It is used to authorize additional amount over the previously authorized amount stored in the systems, if the requested amount is higher.  In the case that authorization id is no longer valid (e.g. voided or used), it would return an error.  For expired authorization id, it would do a fresh authorization.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Bank Source
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The bank source used to fund the payment

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: ACH bank payment object
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: ACH bank details required to fund the payment.

account_number.description: The US bank account number from which the payment will be debited.

routing_number.description: The 9-digit ABA routing transit number for the bank at which the account is held.

account_type.description: Represents the type of the bank account.  If not provided, default is CHECKING.

account_holder_name.description: Name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: PayPal Wallet
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: A resource that identies that a paypal wallet is used for payment.

attributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this wallet.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The merchant-preferred payment methods.

x-enum.description: Accepts any type of payment from the customer.
Accepts only immediate payment from the customer. For example, credit card, PayPal balance, or instant ACH. Ensures that at the time of capture, the payment does not have the `pending` status.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: PayPal wallet Attributes
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this paypal wallet

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Vaulted PayPal Wallet Common Attributes
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Resource consolidating common request and response attirbutes for vaulting PayPal Wallet.

description.description: The description displayed to PayPal consumer on the approval flow for PayPal, as well as on the PayPal payment token management experience on PayPal.com.

product_label.description: Merchant/Partner defined identifier uniquely identify merchant/partner's business and the usage of the PayPal payment token for the business. Please contact your PayPal Technical Account Manager to define the product_label for your business and how it can help your business. For details on â€œproduct_labelâ€ and different types of usages of a PayPal Payment Token, please refer to documentation. For a business with different type of usage of the payment method, a new product_label needs to be defined and a new PayPal Payment Token will be created. For including multiple businesses of same charge pattern, an existing product_label with the same charge pattern can be leveraged. Business can decide to use custom name for the product_label. If no product_label is specified, default policies will apply for PayPal payment method, irrespective of the nature of the business.

shipping.description: The shipping address for the Payer.

usage_type.description: The usage type associated with the PayPal payment token.

x-enum.description: The PayPal Payment Token will be used for future transaction directly with a merchant.
The PayPal Payment Token will be used for future transaction on a platform. A platform is typically a marketplace or a channel that a payer can purchase goods and services from multiple merchants.

customer_type.description: The customer type associated with the PayPal payment token. This is to indicate whether the customer acting on the merchant / platform is either a business or a consumer.

x-enum.description: The customer vaulting the PayPal payment token is a consumer on the merchant / platform.
The customer vaulting the PayPal payment token is a business on merchant / platform.

permit_multiple_payment_tokens.description: Create multiple payment tokens for the same payer, merchant/platform combination. Use this when the customer has not logged in at merchant/platform. The payment token thus generated, can then also be used to create the customer account at merchant/platform. Use this also when multiple payment tokens are required for the same payer, different customer at merchant/platform. This helps to identify customers distinctly even though they may share the same PayPal account. This only applies to PayPal payment source.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The shipping details.
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Shipping Details

name.description: The name of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `full_name` property.

options.description: An array of shipping options that the payee or merchant offers to the payer to ship or pick up their items.

items.description: The option that the payee or merchant offers to the payer to ship or pick up their items.

address.description: The address of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Name
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The name of the party.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Shipping Option
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The options that the payee or merchant offers to the payer to ship or pick up their items.

id.description: A unique ID that identifies a payer-selected shipping option.

label.description: A description that the payer sees, which helps them choose an appropriate shipping option. For example, `Free Shipping`, `USPS Priority Shipping`, `ExpÃ©dition prioritaire USPS`, or `USPS yÅuxiÄn fÄ huÃ²`. Localize this description to the payer's locale.

type.description: The method by which the payer wants to get their items.

amount.description: The shipping cost for the selected option.

selected.description: If the API request sets `selected = true`, it represents the shipping option that the payee or merchant expects to be pre-selected for the payer when they first view the `shipping.options` in the PayPal Checkout experience. As part of the response if a `shipping.option` contains `selected=true`, it represents the shipping option that the payer selected during the course of checkout with PayPal. Only one `shipping.option` can be set to `selected=true`.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Shipping Type
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The method by which the payer wants to get their items.

x-enum.description: The payer intends to receive the items at a specified address.
The payer intends to pick up the items at a specified address. For example, a store address.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Money
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.

value.description:
The value, which might be:

  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Amount with Breakdown
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description:
The total order amount with an optional breakdown that provides details, such as the total item amount, total tax amount, shipping, handling, insurance, and discounts, if any.
If you specify `amount.breakdown`, the amount equals `item_total` plus `tax_total` plus `shipping` plus `handling` plus `insurance` minus `shipping_discount` minus discount.
The amount must be a positive number. For listed of supported currencies and decimal precision, see the PayPal REST APIs Currency Codes.
The breakdown of the amount. Breakdown provides details such as total item amount, total tax amount, shipping, handling, insurance, and discounts, if any.
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Amount Breakdown

item_total.description: The subtotal for all items. Required if the request includes `purchase_units[].items[].unit_amount`. Must equal the sum of `(items[].unit_amount * items[].quantity)` for all items. item_total.value can not be a negative number.

shipping.description: The shipping fee for all items within a given `purchase_unit`. shipping.value can not be a negative number.

handling.description: The handling fee for all items within a given `purchase_unit`. handling.value can not be a negative number.

tax_total.description: The total tax for all items. Required if the request includes `purchase_units.items.tax`. Must equal the sum of `(items[].tax * items[].quantity)` for all items. tax_total.value can not be a negative number.

insurance.description: The insurance fee for all items within a given `purchase_unit`. insurance.value can not be a negative number.

shipping_discount.description: The shipping discount for all items within a given `purchase_unit`. shipping_discount.value can not be a negative number.

discount.description: The discount for all items within a given `purchase_unit`. discount.value can not be a negative number.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Payee
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The merchant who receives the funds and fulfills the order. The merchant is also known as the payee.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Merchant Base
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details for the merchant who receives the funds and fulfills the order. The merchant is also known as the payee.

merchant_id.description: The encrypted PayPal account ID of the merchant.

client_id.description: The public ID for the payee- or merchant-created app. Introduced to support use cases, such as BrainTree integration with PayPal, where payee `email_address` or `merchant_id` is not available.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: PayPal Account Identifier
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The account identifier for a PayPal account.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Displayable Merchant Information
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The merchant information. The merchant is also known as the payee. Appears to the customer in checkout, transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

business_email.description: The email address of the merchant. Appears to the customer in checkout, transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

business_phone.description: The phone number of the merchant. Appears to the customer in checkout, payment transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

brand_name.description: The name of the merchant. Appears to the customer in checkout, payment transactions, email receipts, and transaction history.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Phone
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Item
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details for the items to be purchased.

name.description: The item name or title.

unit_amount.description: The item price or rate per unit. If you specify unit_amount, purchase_units[].amount.breakdown.item_total is required. Must equal unit_amount * quantity for all items. unit_amount.value can not be a negative number.

tax.description: The item tax for each unit. If tax is specified, purchase_units[].amount.breakdown.tax_total is required. Must equal tax * quantity for all items. tax.value can not be a negative number.

quantity.description: The item quantity. Must be a whole number.

sku.description: The stock keeping unit (SKU) for the item.

x-enum.description: Goods that are stored, delivered, and used in their electronic format. This value is not currently supported for API callers that leverage the [PayPal for Commerce Platform](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/commerce-platform) product.
A tangible item that can be shipped with proof of delivery.

A contribution or gift for which no good or service is exchanged, usually to a not for profit organization. This category is restricted to approved API Callers and Payee. Please speak to your account manager if you want to process this type of items.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Authorization
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The authorized payment transaction.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the authorized payment.

amount.description: The amount for this authorized payment.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

alternate_id.description: The PayPal-generated alternate ID for the authorized payment. For example, used for UATP airline integration.

expiration_time.description: The date and time when the authorized payment expires, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Authorization Status
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The status fields for an authorized payment.

status.description: The status for the authorized payment.

x-enum.description: The authorized payment is created. No captured payments have been made for this authorized payment.
The authorized payment has one or more captures against it. The sum of these captured payments is greater than the amount of the original authorized payment.
PayPal cannot authorize funds for this authorized payment.
A captured payment was made for the authorized payment for an amount that is less than the amount of the original authorized payment.
The payment which was authorized for an amount that is less than the originally requested amount.
The authorized payment was voided. No more captured payments can be made against this authorized payment.
The created authorization is in pending state. For more information, see status.details.

status_details.description: The details of the authorized order pending status.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Auhorization Status Details
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details of the authorized payment status.

reason.description: The reason why the authorized status is `PENDING`.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The level of protection offered as defined by [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Seller Protection

status.description: Indicates whether the transaction is eligible for seller protection. For information, see [PayPal Seller Protection for Merchants](https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/security/seller-protection).

x-enum.description: Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that they did not receive an item or the account holder claims that they did not authorize the payment.
Your PayPal balance remains intact if the customer claims that they did not receive an item.
This transaction is not eligible for seller protection.

dispute_categories.description: An array of conditions that are covered for the transaction.

items.description: The condition that is covered for the transaction.

x-enum.description: The payer paid for an item that they did not receive.
The payer did not authorize the payment.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Link Description
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The request-related [HATEOAS link](/docs/api/reference/api-responses/#hateoas-links) information.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

mediaType.description: The media type, as defined by [RFC 2046](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2046.txt). Describes the link target.

encType.description: The media type in which to submit the request data.

schema.description: The schema that describes the request data.

targetSchema.description: The schema that describes the link target.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Link Schema
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The request data or link target.

allOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against all sub-schemas.

items.title: All Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

anyOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one or more sub-schemas.

items.title: Any Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

oneOf.description: An array of sub-schemas. The data must validate against one sub-schema.

items.title: One Of Item
items.description: A sub-schema against which the data must validate.

media.title: Media
media.description: The media type and context-encoding scheme.

type.description: The media type. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Two: Media Types](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2046).

binaryEncoding.description: The content-encoding scheme. See [Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part One: Format of Internet Message Bodies](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2045).

pathStart.description: To apply this schema to the instances' URIs, start the URIs with this value.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The date and time stamps that are common to authorized payment, captured payment, and refund transactions.
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Transaction Date and Time Stamps

create_time.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

update_time.description: The date and time when the transaction was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Error
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The error details.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

details.description: An array of additional details about the error.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Error Details
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

capture_request.json.title: Capture Request
capture_request.json.description: Captures either a portion or the full authorized amount of an authorized payment.

amount.description: The amount to capture. To capture a portion of the full authorized amount, specify an amount. If amount is not specified, the full authorized amount is captured. The amount must be a positive number and in the same currency as the authorization against which the payment is being captured.

final_capture.description: Indicates whether you can make additional captures against the authorized payment. Set to `true` if you do not intend to capture additional payments against the authorization. Set to `false` if you intend to capture additional payments against the authorization.

supplementary_purchase_data.json.title: Capture Identifier
supplementary_purchase_data.json.description: The capture identification-related fields. Includes the invoice ID, custom ID, note to payer, and soft descriptor.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

note_to_payer.description: An informational note about this settlement. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

soft_descriptor.description: Note: This field has been marked INTERNAL to ensure backward compatibility, please do not use this for any future integrations as this field is not supported for this end point. The payment descriptor that appears on the customer's credit card statement for this transaction.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Payment Instruction
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Any additional payment instructions for PayPal Commerce Platform customers. Enables features for the PayPal Commerce Platform, such as delayed disbursement and collection of a platform fee. Applies during order creation for captured payments or during capture of authorized payments.

platform_fees.description: An array of various fees, commissions, tips, or donations.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Platform Fee
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The platform or partner fee, commission, or brokerage fee that is associated with the transaction. Not a separate or isolated transaction leg from the external perspective. The platform fee is limited in scope and is always associated with the original payment for the purchase unit.

payee.description: The recipient of the fee for this transaction. If you omit this value, the default is the API caller.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Disbursement Mode
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The funds that are held on behalf of the merchant.

x-enum.description: The funds are released to the merchant immediately.

The funds are held for a finite number of days. The actual duration depends on the region and type of integration. You can release the funds through a referenced payout. Otherwise, the funds disbursed automatically after the specified duration.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Supplementary Data
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The supplementary data.

airline.description: An array of airline itineraries' data, including ticket, passenger, and airline details.

point_of_sale.description: The API caller-provided information about the store.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Airline Itinerary
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The airline itinerary details.

flight_leg_details.description: An array of the airline itinerary legs.

clearing_sequence.description: For direct airline integration, numeric code to identify each clearing record message in those cases where multiple clearing messages are allowed per authorized transaction. Applicable to multiple captures against an authorization. In the case of single capture against an authorization, the value should be 1. Also, this value must be less than or equal to the clearing count.

clearing_count.description: For direct airline integration, numeric code to identify the total number of multiple sequence clearing record messages associated with a single authorization request. Applicable to multiple captures against an authorization. In the case of single capture against an authorization the value should be 1.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Airline Ticket Detail
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details for the airline ticket.

number.description: The airline-issued ticket number or ID.

issue_date.description: The date when the airline ticket was issued.

issuing_carrier_code.description: The carrier code of the ticket issuer.

travel_agency_name.description: The name of the travel agency that issued the ticket.

travel_agency_code.description: The IATA number, also ARC number or ARC/IATA number. The unique code or number for the travel agency that issued this ticket.

restricted_ticket.description: Indicates whether the ticket is restricted.

fare.description: The total fare of the entire itinerary, including the legs.

tax.description: The total tax of the entire itinerary, including the legs.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Airline Passenger Detail
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The airline passenger details.

name.description: The name of the passenger. Supports only the `full_name` property.

date_of_birth.description: The date of birth of the passenger.

customer_code.description: The card holder-supplied code to the merchant. Can be used for passing in the frequent flyer number of the customer.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Flight Leg
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details of the flight leg.

flight_code.description: The flight number of the current leg.

flight_number.description: The flight number of the current leg.

carrier_code.description: The IATA two-letter accounting code that identifies the carrier.

service_class.description: The service class to which the airline ticket applies.

departure_time.description: The local time when the flight departs from the airport.

departure_airport.description: The airport code, as defined by [IATA](https://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx).

arrival_airport.description: The airport code, as defined by [IATA](https://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx).

stopover_code.description: The one-letter code that indicates whether the passenger is entitled to make a stopover.

fare_basis_code.description: The code used by airline to identify a fare type and enable airline staff and travel agents to find the rules for this ticket.

arrival_time.description: Local time at which flight arrives at the destination.

conjunction_ticket_number.description: A ticket in conjunction  with  another ticket, which together make up a single contract of carriage.

fare.description: Fare details in the current leg.

fee.description: Fees for this leg of the trip.

additional_notations.description: An endorsement or restriction on the ticket. An endorsement can be an agency-added notation or a mandatory government required notation, such as a value-added tax. A restriction is a limitation based on the type of fare, such as a ticket with a three-day minimum stay.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The time, in the hh:mm 24 Hr format.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Point of sale
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The API caller-provided information about the store.

store_id.description: The API caller-provided external store identification number.

terminal_id.description: The API caller-provided external terminal identification number.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Capture
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: A captured payment.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the captured payment.

amount.description: The amount for this captured payment.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

final_capture.description: Indicates whether you can make additional captures against the authorized payment. Set to `true` if you do not intend to capture additional payments against the authorization. Set to `false` if you intend to capture additional payments against the authorization.

processor_response.description: An object that provides additional processor information for a direct credit card transaction.

supplementary_data.description: An object that provides supplementary/additional data for a payment transaction that might be sent to the processor if a credit card is involved. This object is designed to pass information that depending on the type of data passed and use case can lead to an improvement in conversion rates, manage risk and ensure compliance. Currently this object allows the API caller to specify airline_itineraries if the transaction includes an airline ticket purchase.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Capture Status
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The status of a captured payment.

status.description: The status of the captured payment.

x-enum.description: The funds for this captured payment were credited to the payee's PayPal account.
The funds could not be captured.
An amount less than this captured payment's amount was partially refunded to the payer.
The funds for this captured payment was not yet credited to the payee's PayPal account. For more information, see status.details.
An amount greater than or equal to this captured payment's amount was refunded to the payer.
There was an error while capturing payment.

status_details.description: The details of the captured payment status.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Capture Status Details
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details of the captured payment status.

reason.description: The reason why the captured payment status is `PENDING` or `DENIED`.

x-enum.description: The payer initiated a dispute for this captured payment with PayPal.
The captured funds were reversed in response to the payer disputing this captured payment with the issuer of the financial instrument used to pay for this captured payment.
The payer paid by an eCheck that has not yet cleared.
Visit your online account. In your **Account Overview**, accept and deny this payment.
No additional specific reason can be provided. For more information about this captured payment, visit your account online or contact PayPal.
The captured payment is pending manual review.

The payee has not yet set up appropriate receiving preferences for their account. For more information about how to accept or deny this payment, visit your account online. This reason is typically offered in scenarios such as when the currency of the captured payment is different from the primary holding currency of the payee.
The payer must send the funds for this captured payment. This code generally appears for manual EFTs.
The payee does not have a PayPal account.
The payee's PayPal account is not verified.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Parent Transaction
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: Information about the parent transaction.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for Authorization or Order this transaction is capturing.

type.description: The payment type the parent transaction.

x-enum.description: The parent transaction is an authorization.
The parent transaction is an order.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Seller Receivable Breakdown
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The detailed breakdown of the capture activity.

gross_amount.description: The amount for this captured payment in the currency of the transaction.

paypal_fee.description: The applicable fee for this captured payment in the currency of the transaction.

paypal_fee_in_receivable_currency.description: The applicable fee for this captured payment in the receivable currency. Returned only in cases the fee is charged in the receivable currency. Example 'CNY'.

net_amount.description: The net amount that the payee receives for this captured payment in their PayPal account. The net amount is computed as gross_amount minus the paypal_fee minus the platform_fees.

receivable_amount.description: The net amount that is credited to the payee's PayPal account. Returned only when the currency of the captured payment is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee wants to credit the funds. The amount is computed as net_amount times exchange_rate.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount that is credited to the payee's PayPal account. Returned when the currency of the captured payment is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee wants to credit the funds.

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees that associated with the captured payment.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount to convert from one currency to another currency.
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Exchange Rate

source_currency.description: The source currency from which to convert an amount.

target_currency.description: The target currency to which to convert an amount.

value.description: The target currency amount. Equivalent to one unit of the source currency. Formatted as integer or decimal value with one to 15 digits to the right of the decimal point.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Processor Response
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The processor information. Might be required for payment requests, such as direct credit card transactions.

For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, the address matches. International A.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, no values match. International N.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, the address and postal code match. International X.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, not allowed for Internet or phone transactions. For American Express card holder, the name is incorrect but the address and postal code match.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, the address and postal code match. UK-specific X. For American Express card holder, the name is incorrect but the address matches.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, global is unavailable. Nothing matches.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, international is unavailable. Not applicable.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, the address and postal code match. For American Express card holder, the name, address, and postal code match.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, nothing matches. For American Express card holder, the address and postal code are both incorrect.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, postal international Z. Postal code only.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, re-try the request. For American Express, the system is unavailable.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, the service is not supported.

For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, the service is unavailable. For American Express, information is not available. For Maestro, the address is not checked or the acquirer had no response. The service is not available.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, whole ZIP code. For American Express, the card holder name, address, and postal code are all incorrect.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, exact match of the address and the nine-digit ZIP code. For American Express, the card holder name, address, and postal code are all incorrect.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, the address and five-digit ZIP code match. For American Express, the card holder address and postal code are both correct.
For Visa, Mastercard, or Discover transactions, the five-digit ZIP code matches but no address. For American Express, only the card holder postal code is correct.
For Maestro, no AVS response was obtained.
For Maestro, all address information matches.
For Maestro, none of the address information matches.
For Maestro, part of the address information matches.
For Maestro, the merchant did not provide AVS information. It was not processed.
For Maestro, the address was not checked or the acquirer had no response. The service is not available.

cvv_code.description: The card verification value code for for Visa, Discover, Mastercard, or American Express.

x-enum.description: For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, error - unrecognized or unknown response.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, invalid or null.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, the CVV2/CSC matches.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, the CVV2/CSC does not match.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, it was not processed.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, the service is not supported.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, unknown - the issuer is not certified.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, no response. For Maestro, the service is not available.
For Visa, Mastercard, Discover, or American Express, error.
For Maestro, the CVV2 did not match.
For Maestro, the merchant has not implemented CVV2 code handling.
For Maestro, the merchant has indicated that CVV2 is not present on card.
For Maestro, the service is not available.

response_code.description: Processor response code for the non-PayPal payment processor errors.

x-enum.description: PICKUP_CARD_SPECIAL_CONDITIONS. Try using another card. Do not retry the same card.
INVALID_OR_RESTRICTED_CARD. Try using another card. Do not retry the same card.
SUSPECTED_FRAUD. Try using another card. Do not retry the same card.
LOST_OR_STOLEN. Try using another card. Do not retry the same card.
HOLD_CALL_CENTER. The merchant must call the number on the back of the card. POS scenario.

payment_advice_code.description: The declined payment transactions might have payment advice codes. The card networks, like Visa and Mastercard, return payment advice codes.

x-enum.description: For Mastercard, expired card account upgrade or portfolio sale conversion. Obtain new account information before next billing cycle.

For Mastercard, over credit limit or insufficient funds. Retry the transaction 72 hours later. For Visa, the card holder wants to stop only one specific payment in the recurring payment relationship. The merchant must NOT resubmit the same transaction. The merchant can continue the billing process in the subsequent billing period.

For Mastercard, account closed as fraudulent. Obtain another type of payment from customer due to account being closed or fraud. Possible reason: Account closed as fraudulent. For Visa, the card holder wants to stop all recurring payment transactions for a specific merchant. Stop recurring payment requests.

For Mastercard, the card holder has been unsuccessful at canceling recurring payment through merchant. Stop recurring payment requests. For Visa, all recurring payments were canceled for the card number requested. Stop recurring payment requests.

reauthorize_request.json.title: Reauthorize Request
reauthorize_request.json.description:
Reauthorizes an authorized PayPal account payment, by ID. To ensure that funds are still available, reauthorize a payment after its initial three-day honor period expires. You can reauthorize a payment only once from days four to 29.

If 30 days have transpired since the date of the original authorization, you must create an authorized payment instead of reauthorizing the original authorized payment.

A reauthorized payment itself has a new honor period of three days.

You can reauthorize an authorized payment once for up to 115% of the original authorized amount, not to exceed an increase of $75 USD.

Supports only the `amount` request parameter.
Note: This request is currently not supported for Partner use cases.

amount.description: The amount to reauthorize for an authorized payment.

order_capture_request.json.title: Capture Request
order_capture_request.json.description: Captures either a portion or the full order amount of an approved and saved order.

order_id.description: The identifier of the order for this capture.

refund_request.json.title: Refund Request
refund_request.json.description: Refunds a captured payment, by ID. For a full refund, include an empty request body. For a partial refund, include an amount object in the request body.

amount.description: The amount to refund. To refund a portion of the captured amount, specify an amount. If amount is not specified, an amount equal to captured amount - previous refunds is refunded. The amount must be a positive number and in the same currency as the one in which the payment was captured.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

note_to_payer.description: The reason for the refund. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Refund
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The refund information.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the refund.

amount.description: The amount that the payee refunded to the payer.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

note_to_payer.description: The reason for the refund. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

gross_amount.description: The amount that the payee refunded to the payer.

paypal_fee.description: The PayPal fee that was refunded to the payer. This fee might not match the PayPal fee that the payee paid when the payment was captured.

net_amount.description: The net amount that the payee's account is debited, if the payee holds funds in the currency for this refund. The net amount is calculated as gross_amount minus paypal_fee minus platform_fees.

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees for the refund.

net_amount_breakdown.description: An array of breakdown values for the net amount. Returned when the currency of the refund is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee holds their funds.

total_refunded_amount.description: The total amount refunded from the original capture to date. For example, if a payer makes a $100 purchase and was refunded $20 a week ago and was refunded $30 in this refund, the `gross_amount` is $30 for this refund and the `total_refunded_amount` is $50.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The refund status.
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Refund Status

x-enum.description: The refund is pending. For more information, see status_details.reason.

status_details.description: The details of the refund status.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The details of the refund status.

reason.description: The reason why the refund has the `PENDING` or `FAILED` status.

x-enum.description: The customer's account is funded through an eCheck, which has not yet cleared.

MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.title: Net Amount Breakdown Item
MerchantCommonComponentsSpecification-v1.description: The net amount. Returned when the currency of the refund is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the merchant holds their funds.

payable_amount.description: The net amount debited from the merchant's PayPal account.

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount that was debited from the merchant's PayPal account.

customized_x_unsupported_4024_MerchantCo.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)
customized_x_unsupported_4024_MerchantCo.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

customized_x_unsupported_7804_MerchantCo.title: Vaulted PayPal Wallet Common Attributes
customized_x_unsupported_7804_MerchantCo.description: Resource consolidating common request and response attirbutes for vaulting PayPal Wallet.

description.description: The description displayed to PayPal consumer on the approval flow for PayPal, as well as on the PayPal payment token management experience on PayPal.com.

product_label.description: Merchant/Partner defined identifier uniquely identify merchant/partner's business and the usage of the PayPal payment token for the business. Please contact your PayPal Technical Account Manager to define the product_label for your business and how it can help your business. For details on â€œproduct_labelâ€ and different types of usages of a PayPal Payment Token, please refer to documentation. For a business with different type of usage of the payment method, a new product_label needs to be defined and a new PayPal Payment Token will be created. For including multiple businesses of same charge pattern, an existing product_label with the same charge pattern can be leveraged. Business can decide to use custom name for the product_label. If no product_label is specified, default policies will apply for PayPal payment method, irrespective of the nature of the business.

usage_type.description: The usage type associated with the PayPal payment token.

x-enum.description: The PayPal Payment Token will be used for future transaction directly with a merchant.
The PayPal Payment Token will be used for future transaction on a platform. A platform is typically a marketplace or a channel that a payer can purchase goods and services from multiple merchants.

customer_type.description: The customer type associated with the PayPal payment token. This is to indicate whether the customer acting on the merchant / platform is either a business or a consumer.

x-enum.description: The customer vaulting the PayPal payment token is a consumer on the merchant / platform.
The customer vaulting the PayPal payment token is a business on merchant / platform.

permit_multiple_payment_tokens.description: Create multiple payment tokens for the same payer, merchant/platform combination. Use this when the customer has not logged in at merchant/platform. The payment token thus generated, can then also be used to create the customer account at merchant/platform. Use this also when multiple payment tokens are required for the same payer, different customer at merchant/platform. This helps to identify customers distinctly even though they may share the same PayPal account. This only applies to PayPal payment source.

name.description: The name of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `full_name` property.

address.description: The address of the person to whom to ship the items. Supports only the `address_line_1`, `address_line_2`, `admin_area_1`, `admin_area_2`, `postal_code`, and `country_code` properties.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

x-errors.name: PAYER_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_OR_CLOSED
x-errors.message: The payer account cannot be used for this transaction.
x-errors.description: Contact the payer for an alternate payment method.

x-errors.name: PAYER_CANNOT_PAY
x-errors.message: Payer cannot pay for this transaction.
x-errors.description: Please contact the payer to find other ways to pay for this transaction.

x-errors.name: PENDING_CAPTURE
x-errors.message: Cannot initiate a refund as the capture is pending.
x-errors.description: Capture is typically pending when the payer has funded the transaction by using an e-check or bank account.

x-errors.name: PERMISSION_DENIED
x-errors.message: You do not have permission to access or perform operations on this resource.
x-errors.description: To make API calls on behalf of a merchant, ensure that you have sufficient permissions to proceed with this transaction.

x-errors.name: PERMISSION_NOT_GRANTED
x-errors.message: Payee of the authorization has not granted permission to perform capture on the authorization.
x-errors.description: To make API calls on behalf of a merchant, ensure that you have sufficient permissions to capture the authorization.

x-errors.name: PREVIOUSLY_CAPTURED
x-errors.message: Authorization has been previously captured and hence cannot be voided.
x-errors.description: This authorized payment was already captured. You cannot capture it again.

x-errors.name: PREVIOUSLY_VOIDED
x-errors.message: Authorization has been previously voided and hence cannot be voided again.
x-errors.description: This authorized payment was already voided. You cannot void it again.

x-errors.name: REFUND_AMOUNT_EXCEEDED
x-errors.message: The refund amount must be less than or equal to the capture amount that has not yet been refunded.
x-errors.description: Verify the refund amount and try the request again.

x-errors.name: REFUND_CAPTURE_CURRENCY_MISMATCH
x-errors.message: Refund must be in the same currency as the capture.
x-errors.description: Verify the currency of the refund and try the request again.

x-errors.name: REFUND_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
x-errors.message: Capture could not be refunded due to insufficient funds.
x-errors.description: Verify that either you have sufficient funds in your PayPal account or the bank account that is linked to your PayPal account is verified and has sufficient funds.

x-errors.name: REFUND_NOT_ALLOWED
x-errors.message: Full refund refused - partial refund has already been done on this payment.
x-errors.description: You cannot refund this capture.

x-errors.name: REFUND_TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
x-errors.message: You are over the time limit to perform a refund on this capture.
x-errors.description: The refund cannot be issued at this time.

x-errors.name: TRANSACTION_REFUSED
x-errors.message: PayPal's internal controls prevent authorization from being captured.
x-errors.description: For more information about this transaction, contact customer support.

x-errors.name: REFUND_NOT_SUPPORTED_FOR_PAYMENT_SOURCE
x-errors.message: Refund was refused by the payment source.
x-errors.description: Refunds are not supported for the payer's selected payment source. Contact the payer directly to arrange a refund via alternative means.

x-errors.name: REFUND_TIME_EXCEEDED_FOR_PAYMENT_SOURCE
x-errors.message: Refund was refused by the payment source.
x-errors.description: The time limit set by the payer's selected payment source to refund this transaction has expired. Contact the payer directly to arrange a refund via alternative means.

x-errors.name: REFUND_FAILED_BY_PAYMENT_SOURCE
x-errors.message: Refund was refused by the payment source.
x-errors.description: We're unable to process refunds for the payer's selected payment source. Contact the payer directly to arrange a refund via alternative means.
